titleInfo.title: Andrew Jackson equestrian statue in Nashville, Tennessee, 1897 October 09

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: An 1897 photograph of the equestrian statue of Andrew Jackson Statue located on the grounds of the Tennessee State Capitol in Nashville, Tennessee. A group of ladies in 19th century attire are pictured in front of the statue and several large residential mansions can be seen in the background. This statue depicts Andrew Jackson at the Battle of New Orleans and was sculpted by American sculptor Clark Mills. The statue is the first design of a person on horseback ever cast in the United States. It is one of three identical statues located at Nashville, New Orleans, and Washington, D.C. respectively. The monument was dedicated during Nashville's centennial celebration in May 1880. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 5 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
